page.title: 01WALLOP 1985.
page.content: Our area is situated where Wiltshire meets Hampshire; where the broad sweep of Salisbury Plain merges imperceptibly into the wooded hills of the Hampshire basin. The main settlements follow the course of the Wallop Brook with an occasional outlying farmstead. The village blacksmith has his forge beneath a majestic horse chestnut tree. The houses, many still thatched in the traditional manner of the area, snuggle in the valley. Trout, ducks and moorhens swim in the river where ancient fords still make the easiest crossings.Farming is the main occupation of the people, as it was in the time of the Domesday Book 1085 although tractors,not oxen,now pull the ploughs.
